page.title: 11Housing in Enfield Town
page.content: The area surrounding the market place provides a rich variety of domestic and commercial architecture. The vicarge dates back to medieval times and many other buildings testify to Enfield's rich historical past.Most housing in the area dates from 1890 as this market town became absorbed onto the northern spread of London which accompanied the development of the railways. Typical of this period is the ornate Edwardian villain London Rd. or the smaller terraced dwellings housing the growing artesian class.{Gentlemans Row}exhibits former humble farm labourers cottages which date back to 1680(now modernised & extended), to grander Georgian houses with room for servants & stabling. Today this area provides a haven of peace from the busy traffic.
